article.title: Foreign_relations_of_Dominica
article.paragraph: Use dmy datesJuly 2012Politics of DominicaLike itsEastern Caribbeanneighbors, the main priority ofDominica's foreign relations is economic development. The country maintains missions in Washington, New York, London, and Brussels and is represented jointly with otherOrganisation of Eastern Caribbean States(OECS) members inCanada. Dominica is also a member of theCaribbean Development Bank(CDB), and theCommonwealth of Nations. It became a member of theUnited Nationsand theInternational Monetary Fund(IMF) in 1978 and of theWorld BankandOrganization of American States(OAS) in 1979.

As a member ofCARICOM, in July 1994 Dominica strongly backed efforts by the United States to implementUnited Nations Security Council Resolution 940, designed to facilitate the departure ofHaiti's de facto authorities from power. The country agreed to contribute personnel to the multinational force, which restored the democratically elected government of Haiti in October 1994.

In May 1997, Prime MinisterEdison JamesJamesjoined 14 other Caribbean leaders, and PresidentBill ClintonClinton, during the first-ever U.S.-regional summit inBridgetown, Barbados. The summit strengthened the basis for regional cooperation on justice and counternarcotics issues, finance and development, and trade. Dominica previously maintained official relations with theRepublic of China(commonly known as "Taiwan") instead of thePeople's Republic of China, but on 23 March 2004, a joint communique was signed in Beijing, paving the way for diplomatic recognition of the People's Republic. Beijing responded to Dominica's severing relations with the Republic of China by giving them a $12 million aid package, which includes $6 million inbudget supportfor the year 2004 and $1 million annually for six years.

Dominica is also a member of theInternational Criminal Courtwith a Bilateral Immunity Agreement of protection for theUnited StatesUS-military (as covered underRome Statute of the International Criminal CourtArticle 98).

article.heading: Bilateral relations

tablerow.tablecell: No diplomatic relations were established yet withArmenia.Ministry Foreign Affairs of Armenia
Australiais represented in Dominica through its High Commission in Trinidad and Tobago.Department of Foreign Affairs of Australia
Bilateral relations are described as "close and friendly."Canada - Dominica relationsCanada is represented in Dominica, through its high commission in Barbados.

template.arg: http://www.cancilleria.gov.co/antigua-y-barbuda-barbados-dominica-grenada-san-cristobal-y-nieves-santa-lucia-san-vicente Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Colombia (in Spanish only)

tablerow.tablecell: Both countries established diplomatic relations on December 9, 1980. Colombia is represented in Dominica through its embassy inKingstown,Jamaica.Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Colombia (in Spanish only)
Joint Communiqu on the Establishment of Diplomatic Relations between the Republic ofCroatiaand the Commonwealth of Dominica was signed on the July 30, 2013.Ministry Foreign Affairs of Croatia

template.arg: Permanent Mission of the Commonwealth of Dominica to the United Nations

tablerow.tablecell: Diplomatic relations were established on 31 March 2004, when Dominica suspended ties with theRepublic of China.Timeline: DominicaBBC NEWS

In December 2005, during the second CARICOM/CUBA summit held in Barbados, heads of CARICOM and Cuba agreed to deepen their ties in the areas of socio-economic and political cooperation in addition to medical care assistance. Since the meeting, Cuba has opened four additional embassies in the Caribbean Community including Dominica.Caribbean Net News: Cuba opens more Caribbean embassieswaybackhttp://www.caribbeannetnews.com/cgi-script/csArticles/articles/000008/000823.htm20110611185134

Both countries are members of theCommonwealth of Nations. A Joint Communiqu on the Establishment of Diplomatic Relations between the Republic ofCyprusand the Commonwealth of Dominica was signed on the June 13, 2001 inNew YorkMinistry Foreign Affairs of Cyprus

Denmark is represented in Dominica, through its embassy in Mexico.cite webhttp://www.um.dk/da/menu/OmOs/Organisation/AmbassaderMv/Nordamerika/Dominica.htmDominicaMinistry of Foreign Affairs of Denmark3 November 2010
Finlandrecognised Dominica on February 23, 1979. Diplomatic relations were established on August 19, 2009.Ministry Foreign Affairs of Finland
France is represented in Dominica, through its embassy inSaint Lucia. Dominica and France have signed many bilateral agreements.Bilateral relations between Dominica Francefr icon
Political and economic relations are friendly but fairly low-key.Federal Foreign Office of Germany

Diplomatic relations were established on November 15, 2005.Greeceis represented in Dominica via parallel accreditation of its embassy inCaracas. Dominica has appointed an ambassador accredited to Greece, based inRoseau, Dominica.Ministry Foreign Affairs of Greece
Guyana has aHigh CommissioninRoseau.Guyana's Diplomatic & Consular Representatives
Indonesia is represented in Dominica through its embassy inCaracas,Venezuela

Diplomatic relations were established in December 1978.Ministry Foreign Affairs of JapanJapanis represented in Dominica through its embassy in Trinidad and Tobago.http://www.tt.emb-japan.go.jp/about%20us.htm

Since November 1978, the bilateral relations have been cordial and fruitful.http://search.naver.com/search.naver?where=nexearch&query=%EB%B6%81%ED%95%9C+%EB%8F%84%EB%AF%B8%EB%8B%88%EC%B9%B4+%EC%88%98%EA%B5%90&sm=top_hty&fbm=0&ie=utf8http://www.mfa.gov.lv/en/news/latest-news/8841-latvia-establishes-diplomatic-relations-with-dominica
Diplomatic relations were established on September 27, 2007 inNew York.Ministry Foreign Affairs of Latvia
Diplomatic relations were established on October 7, 2013.Ministry Foreign Affairs of Lithuania
Both countries are members of theCommonwealth of Nations. Diplomatic relations were established on February 11, 2005 inNew York.Ministry Foreign Affairs of Malta
Diplomatic relations were established on November 18, 2011.Ministry Foreign Affairs of Mongolia

Dominica recognised theState of Palestineand established diplomatic relations on 14 September 2011.cite webInternational recognition of the State of Palestinehttp://www.nad-plo.org/userfiles/image/English%20127%20%28235x444%29%20map.jpg7 April 2012Negotiations Affairs DepartmentPalestinian National Authority25 September 2011cite webInternational recognition of the State of Palestinehttp://www.nad-plo.org/userfiles/image/English%20map%20%28444X235%29128.jpg7 April 2012Negotiations Affairs DepartmentPalestinian National Authority26 September 2011: "128 UN Member States recognize Palestine"cite newsDominica supports upgraded UN status for Palestinian Authorityhttp://dominicanewsonline.com/news/homepage/news/politics/dominica-supports-upgraded-un-status-for-palestinian-authority/12 December 2012Dominica News Online30 November 2012cite webBolivarian Alliance for the Peoples of Our AmericaComunicado especial sobre Palestinahttp://www.alianzabolivariana.org/modules.php?nameSpanish10 September 20112011-09-17
Since November 1978, the bilateral relations have been cordial and fruitful.Korean Government Continues To Support Dominica As Protocol Vehicle Is Handed To Ministry Of Foreign Affairs
Diplomatic relations were established on January 30, 2009.Ministry Foreign Affairs of Romania
Both countries are members of theCommonwealth of Nations. Diplomatic relations were established on April 29, 1998.Department of International Cooperation of South Africa
Sweden has an honorary consulate in Roseau.
Diplomatic and economic relations betweenSwitzerlandand Dominica are of minor importance.Federal Department of Foreign Affairs of Switzerland
Diplomatic relations were established on April 2006 inNew York.Ministry Foreign Affairs of Turkey
Diplomatic relations between Dominica and the UAE were established on 21 December 2014.
On 3 November 1978, Dominica received independence from the United Kingdom.

The United States and Dominica have friendly relations. United States supports the Dominican government's efforts to expand its economic base and to provide a higherstandard of livingfor its citizens. U.S. assistance is primarily channeled through multilateral agencies such as theWorld Bankand theCaribbean Development Bank, as well as through theU.S. Agency for International Developmentoffice inBridgetown, Barbados.
President of VenezuelaHugo Chvezvisited Dominica in 2007.President Hugo Chvez of Venezuela Pays Historic Visit to DominicaDominica claims Venezuelan island Isla Aves.

article.heading: Dominica and the Commonwealth of Nations
article.paragraph: Dominica has been a member of theCommonwealth of Nationssince 1978, when it became an independentCommonwealth republic.
Despite being a republic, Dominica's highest court is theJudicial Committee of the Privy CouncilinLondon.
